intro: Alkanna orientalis var. leucantha, commonly known as white alkanna, is a flowering plant native to the Middle East and parts of Central Asia. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces striking pink to white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its roots are rich in alkaloids and have been used in traditional medicine. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy ornamental choice in arid climates.
